summary: GAAAHHH EVE AND VILLANELLE'S TWITTERS ARE SO GAY FOR EACH OTHER. AND ITS LIKE CANON TOO?? THE HECK.
question: GAAAHHH EVE AND VILLANELLE'S TWITTERS ARE SO GAY FOR EACH OTHER. AND ITS LIKE CANON TOO?? THE HECK.
answer: What’s really getting me is how super gay Eve’s is!! Like we know how unapologetically gay Villanelle is but Eve is just going for it!

blog.name: theinfinitex
blog.title: Infinitex
blog.description:
Eva | 20 | Video Editor | Gif maker?

Multifandom - Currently Obsessing over Killing Eve & Jodie Comer. 
sideblog @villanellesource

summary:
Soo.. it’s been around two weeks since finale of Killing Eve and I
still find myself wondering about those few certain moments...
caption:
Soo.. it’s been around two weeks since finale of Killing Eve and I still find myself wondering about those few certain moments of betrayal and about Jodie Comer’s performance during those scenes. I remember after watching the episode for the first time I was shook, and I mean really SHOOK by everything that has happened including Jodie’s performance firstly during that scene with Konstantin and later on final few moments with Eve right before shooting her in the back. I just had to make these gifs. The first one is Villanelle’s reaction to being manipulated into killing Aaron, before Konstantin admited that it was not his idea.

We can see how the confusion in her face is quickly replaced by an ironic and painful smile due to disbelief that she was played by the closest person she has to a father figure. The thing is though, in her eyes, it wasn’t the first time Kosntantin had betrayed her. Back to the very end of 1x06 she was left to believe that Konstantin abandoned her in prison instead of coming to pick her up (as he promised)

And here it is… she actually trusted and believed Konstantin, only to find out that she was the one manipulated even though it’s one of the things she’s known to be best at. Manipulation. She manipulated Eve into killing Raymond, yet both of them were manipulated by their bosses. And they both fell for that. They both played the part because they thought they were doing it for each other and for the greater good, while not realizing that their mutual liking to each other will be used against them in this “mission”

It’s really hard for me to understand how can anyone express so many complex feelings in single facial expression, like this one. Jodie did it and she did it several times in the episode and even more times during the entire show. The confusion, the disappointment and realization, the pain, disbelief and surprise are all present, at the same time, following one another. I don’t think I see this kind of performance often in TV shows/movies. It’s so rare and it hit me so hard. Like… in what kind of state of mind Jodie had to get into in order to convey such emotions…. that’s the point of being an actor and no one can say that Villanelle doesn’t feel. Not after these scenes, not after everything that happened to her. Yes, she is different, she feels things differently, but there were so many moments where we (at least I) could relate to her and this one isn’t an exception. This one in particular broke my heart. It broke my heart that Konstantin chose his family over Villanelle. “I thought we were friends.” She said it because she doesn’t know what it’s like to have a family, but Konstantin does and the fact that he doesn’t see Villanelle as a member of his family just hurts, a lot.

Now this scene… again, the painful realization that washes over her face right after Eve rejects her is completely something else. It is similar to the scene with Konstantin, but this is also different. This is Eve. She did try to pull Eve out of it, make her see that they were the same, but it didn’t work and it didn’t work because she’s not like everybody else. She’s familiar with hate, she is familiar with betrayal, she must be familiar with love as well. I do believe she loves Eve, she loves her the best she can and in her own way, unfortunately she doesn’t know how to handle emotions that hit her right afterwards… again, I must repeat myself by mentioning just how phenomenal Jodie’s performance is in this scene as well. Let’s not forget, the soundtrack which was playing during these scenes. Killing Eve really does have amazing soundtracks to fit the unique feel of the show but THIS soundtrack in particular… it resonates with Villanelle a lot, and I am listening to it right now as I’m writing this. It just… pulls you into really vulnerable place where you let your guard down and then it just hits you. Hard. It’s almost nostalgic to a degree.. it’s really difficult to find the words to describe what this song makes me feel and what kind of state of mind it puts me in. It’s something else. I’m completely blown away.

Wow, this was supposed to be a small insight about Jodie’s performance and Villanelle’s feelings, it suddenly turned into a novel lol. Anyways, this is just one of those little aspects that probably not everybody saw/understood, but I did or at least I think I did and I’m more than willing to dive in even deeper once season 3 starts.

reblog.comment:
Soo.. it’s been around two weeks since finale of Killing Eve and I still find myself wondering about those few certain moments of betrayal and about Jodie Comer’s performance during those scenes. I remember after watching the episode for the first time I was shook, and I mean really SHOOK by everything that has happened including Jodie’s performance firstly during that scene with Konstantin and later on final few moments with Eve right before shooting her in the back. I just had to make these gifs. The first one is Villanelle’s reaction to being manipulated into killing Aaron, before Konstantin admited that it was not his idea.

We can see how the confusion in her face is quickly replaced by an ironic and painful smile due to disbelief that she was played by the closest person she has to a father figure. The thing is though, in her eyes, it wasn’t the first time Kosntantin had betrayed her. Back to the very end of 1x06 she was left to believe that Konstantin abandoned her in prison instead of coming to pick her up (as he promised)

And here it is… she actually trusted and believed Konstantin, only to find out that she was the one manipulated even though it’s one of the things she’s known to be best at. Manipulation. She manipulated Eve into killing Raymond, yet both of them were manipulated by their bosses. And they both fell for that. They both played the part because they thought they were doing it for each other and for the greater good, while not realizing that their mutual liking to each other will be used against them in this “mission”

It’s really hard for me to understand how can anyone express so many complex feelings in single facial expression, like this one. Jodie did it and she did it several times in the episode and even more times during the entire show. The confusion, the disappointment and realization, the pain, disbelief and surprise are all present, at the same time, following one another. I don’t think I see this kind of performance often in TV shows/movies. It’s so rare and it hit me so hard. Like… in what kind of state of mind Jodie had to get into in order to convey such emotions…. that’s the point of being an actor and no one can say that Villanelle doesn’t feel. Not after these scenes, not after everything that happened to her. Yes, she is different, she feels things differently, but there were so many moments where we (at least I) could relate to her and this one isn’t an exception. This one in particular broke my heart. It broke my heart that Konstantin chose his family over Villanelle. “I thought we were friends.” She said it because she doesn’t know what it’s like to have a family, but Konstantin does and the fact that he doesn’t see Villanelle as a member of his family just hurts, a lot.

Now this scene… again, the painful realization that washes over her face right after Eve rejects her is completely something else. It is similar to the scene with Konstantin, but this is also different. This is Eve. She did try to pull Eve out of it, make her see that they were the same, but it didn’t work and it didn’t work because she’s not like everybody else. She’s familiar with hate, she is familiar with betrayal, she must be familiar with love as well. I do believe she loves Eve, she loves her the best she can and in her own way, unfortunately she doesn’t know how to handle emotions that hit her right afterwards… again, I must repeat myself by mentioning just how phenomenal Jodie’s performance is in this scene as well. Let’s not forget, the soundtrack which was playing during these scenes. Killing Eve really does have amazing soundtracks to fit the unique feel of the show but THIS soundtrack in particular… it resonates with Villanelle a lot, and I am listening to it right now as I’m writing this. It just… pulls you into really vulnerable place where you let your guard down and then it just hits you. Hard. It’s almost nostalgic to a degree.. it’s really difficult to find the words to describe what this song makes me feel and what kind of state of mind it puts me in. It’s something else. I’m completely blown away.

Wow, this was supposed to be a small insight about Jodie’s performance and Villanelle’s feelings, it suddenly turned into a novel lol. Anyways, this is just one of those little aspects that probably not everybody saw/understood, but I did or at least I think I did and I’m more than willing to dive in even deeper once season 3 starts.

I remember after watching the episode for the first time I was shook, and I mean really SHOOK by everything that has happened including Jodie’s performance firstly during that scene with Konstantin and later on final few moments with Eve right before shooting her in the back. I just had to make these gifs. The first one is Villanelle’s reaction to being manipulated into killing Aaron, before Konstantin admited that it was not his idea.

We can see how the confusion in her face is quickly replaced by an ironic and painful smile due to disbelief that she was played by the closest person she has to a father figure. The thing is though, in her eyes, it wasn’t the first time Kosntantin had betrayed her. Back to the very end of 1x06 she was left to believe that Konstantin abandoned her in prison instead of coming to pick her up (as he promised)

And here it is… she actually trusted and believed Konstantin, only to find out that she was the one manipulated even though it’s one of the things she’s known to be best at. Manipulation. She manipulated Eve into killing Raymond, yet both of them were manipulated by their bosses. And they both fell for that. They both played the part because they thought they were doing it for each other and for the greater good, while not realizing that their mutual liking to each other will be used against them in this “mission”

It’s really hard for me to understand how can anyone express so many complex feelings in single facial expression, like this one. Jodie did it and she did it several times in the episode and even more times during the entire show. The confusion, the disappointment and realization, the pain, disbelief and surprise are all present, at the same time, following one another. I don’t think I see this kind of performance often in TV shows/movies. It’s so rare and it hit me so hard. Like… in what kind of state of mind Jodie had to get into in order to convey such emotions…. that’s the point of being an actor and no one can say that Villanelle doesn’t feel. Not after these scenes, not after everything that happened to her. Yes, she is different, she feels things differently, but there were so many moments where we (at least I) could relate to her and this one isn’t an exception. This one in particular broke my heart. It broke my heart that Konstantin chose his family over Villanelle. “I thought we were friends.” She said it because she doesn’t know what it’s like to have a family, but Konstantin does and the fact that he doesn’t see Villanelle as a member of his family just hurts, a lot.

Now this scene… again, the painful realization that washes over her face right after Eve rejects her is completely something else. It is similar to the scene with Konstantin, but this is also different. This is Eve. She did try to pull Eve out of it, make her see that they were the same, but it didn’t work and it didn’t work because she’s not like everybody else. I do believe she loves Eve, she loves her the best she can and in her own way, unfortunately she doesn’t know how to handle emotions that hit her right afterwards… again, I must repeat myself by mentioning just how phenomenal Jodie’s performance is in this scene as well. Let’s not forget, the soundtrack which was playing during these scenes. Killing Eve really does have amazing soundtracks to fit the unique feel of the show but THIS soundtrack in particular… it resonates with Villanelle a lot, and I am listening to it right now as I’m writing this. It just… pulls you into really vulnerable place where you let your guard down and then it just hits you. Hard. It’s almost nostalgic to a degree.. it’s really difficult to find the words to describe what this song makes me feel and what kind of state of mind it puts me in. It’s something else. I’m completely blown away.

Wow, this was supposed to be a small insight about Jodie’s performance and Villanelle’s feelings, it suddenly turned into a novel lol. Anyways, this is just one of those little aspects that probably not everybody saw/understood, but I did or at least I think I did and I’m more than willing to dive in even deeper once season 3 starts.

summary: Most of the time, most days, I feel nothing. I dont feel anything. Its so boring. I wake up and I think, again, really? I have...
body:
Most of the time, most days, I feel nothing. I dont feel anything. Its so boring. I wake up and I think, again, really? I have to do this again? And what I really dont understand is how come everyone else isn’t screaming with boredom too, and I try to find ways to make myself feel something. More and more and more, but it doesn’t make any difference. No matter what I do, I dont feel anything. I hurt myself, it doesn’t hurt. I buy what I want, I don’t want it. I do what I like, I don’t like it. I’m just so bored.

Villanelle (Killing Eve)

question: Girl idk you obviously but from the personality you put out on this hellsite I feel confident to say you're gonna be a total slut for jodie comer in killing eve. For the record, she also owns my ass. Jodie Comer and Sandra Oh are queens amongst Hollywood trash
answer: Let me tell you how I thought this ask was gonna be you dragging me but I’m pleased that it turned out to be you telling me that I'm going to fall in love with Jodie (we’ve been in love with sandy since greys) 😆💘

tags: send me the asks and headcanons
summary: If your looking for new shows. I recently binged Lucifer. Loved it. It have one last season on Netflix coming. Also the...
question: If your looking for new shows. I recently binged Lucifer. Loved it. It have one last season on Netflix coming. Also the Handmaid's Tale is deep shit but good. And Cloak and Dagger!. Maybe in Siren. It has a polyamorous relationship with a woc in it. So there ya go! Enjoy the summer!
answer: I definitely gotta watch handmaid’s tale and killing eve. The only freeform show i watch is the Fosters spinoff, Good Trouble, which released the first episode of season two on youtube as like a preview for the new season. So many shows so little time 🥴
